title: Ticket #6107: bosco remote ft-gahp config not correct ?
description:
Hi,

When setting up a remote condor endpoint at NERSC with

bosco_cluster --add hufnagel@cori.nersc.gov slurm

the resulting condor_config.ft-gahp doesn't look correct.

I need to add

ENABLE_URL_TRANSFERS = FALSE

to make incoming sandbox transfers work at all and I need to set

USE_SHARED_PORT = FALSE

to avoid blowing up the FTGahpLog with endless error messages

01/11/17 20:58:39 [62232] SharedPortEndpoint: failed to open /global/homes/h/hufnagel/bosco/glite/log/shared_port_ad: No such file or directory

01/11/17 20:58:39 [62232] SharedPortEndpoint: did not successfully find SharedPortServer address. Will retry in 60s.

Cheers

Dirk
remarks:
2017-Jan-24 13:34:39 by jfrey:
I'm surprised by the need to set ENABLE_URL_TRANSFERS=False. Do you have any daemon logs showing what goes wrong if you don't set it?

2017-Jan-25 18:01:52 by hufnagel:
Not at the moment, but I will try to recreate them...

2017-Jan-25 23:21:53 by hufnagel:
Ok, so it's the same as the other. Setting it avoids endless errors in the log. 

01/25/17 20:25:03 [116692] BOSCO: created upload_sandbox thread, id: 119893
01/25/17 20:25:03 [116692] FTGAHP: upload sandbox

c/curl_plugin, ignoring

2017-Mar-01 15:38:05 by johnkn:
CODE_REVIEW : looks good.
